data.title: Paola Bressan
data.meta_description: My main passion is scientific research. I wrote a book about how we see (“Il colore della luna. Come vediamo e perché”; Laterza, 2007) that has been translated into other languages and has won the 2008 Giovanni Maria Pace Award for the best Italian book of scientific popularization. I have also illustrated several children's books. Some of my other interests: reading (fiction and non-fiction), computers and new technologies, mathematical games, illustration, architecture and design, photography, cinema, plants and gardens, new ideas, and anything that hasn’t been explained yet. Academic experience Laurea, University of Padua (Experimental Psychology, 110/110 summa cum laude) \ Research Scientist (Department of General Psychology, University of Padua) \ Visiting scientist (Department of Psychology, University of Surrey, Guildford, UK) \ Research Fellow (Center for Adaptive Systems, Boston University, Boston, USA) \ Research Associate (Department of Psychology, Brandeis University, Waltham, MA, USA) \ Visiting scientist (Laboratory of Experimental Psychology, University of Sussex, Brighton, UK) \ Visiting scientist (Department of Psychology, University of Reading, Reading, UK) Professional services Guest Editor, Perception (1996-1997) * Judge, Best Illusion of the Year Contest (First Edition, 2005) Ad hoc reviewer for PNAS, Journal of Vision [both my reviews there received the award of “Exceptionally good review”], Proceedings of the Royal Society, Psychological Review, Psychological Science, PLoS ONE, Cortex, Perception, Perception & Psychophysics, Journal of Experimental Psychology, Evolution & Human Behavior, Psychological Research, Animal Cognition, Perceptual and Motor Skills, Applied Cognitive Psychology, European Journal of Social Psychology, Psychonomic Bulletin and Review, Social Behavior and Personality, Human Nature, Archives of Sexual Behavior, Journal of the Optical Society of America, Acta Psychologica, Cognition, Vision Research Scientific publications I have published more than 70 scientific papers in refereed international journals, two books on visual perception (also used as textbooks in several Italian universities), and a few chapters in national and international volumes. Media coverage My work has been covered by scientific magazines, newspapers and news agencies, among which: Nature Science Update; Scientific American; Reuters Health (USA); Psychology Today (USA); New York Magazine (USA); BBC Future (UK); Bild der Wissenschaft, Der Spiegel, Der Tagesspiegel, Die Zeit (Germany); SonntagsZeitung (Switzerland); National Geographic (Hungary); Het Parool (Holland); Newton (Japan); The Tribune (India); Klik Magazin (Croatia); Krstarica Magazin (Serbia); La Repubblica, L’Espresso; Focus; Newton Italia; Mente e Cervello (Italy)
